Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I purchased KSP not too long ago and have been having a blast. I'm running into a minor, but annoying issue. The best way I can describe it is "shadow jitter". I've included a screenshot, but it isn't the best example, just the one I managed to capture. Basically, shadows on my craft jump back and forth and all over the place. As well, I get weird lines, for example, where the hexagon edges of the different building areas of the KSC meet, I get artifacts. I've tried messing around with gfx settings, but to no avail.

This is probably the best view of the "lines" problem. The shadow "jitter" I tried to capture an image of, but hey, shadows just look like shadows. Has anyone run into this? And more importantly, found a workaround?

My system specs are as follows:

Intel i5 760 CPU

8.00GB RAM

Win7 Home Premium x64

AMD Radeon HD6850 PCIe

I've updated video drivers, turned off anti-aliasing, messed with shadow and vsync settings in KSP. Help!

Added a couple more images to try to illustrate the problem - these aren't great, but it's hard to capture frame by frame!

This bug also really effects my craft, especially on the Mun, but I just restarted my career save and haven't made it back there yet.
Are you running KSP in DirectX 11 mode? I know that can cause similar issues.
No, just running default. I'm probably going to try rolling back my video drivers to an early version to see if that helps, but I'm not holding my breath.
